clinical_study.brief_title: Nasonex (Mometasone Furoate Nasal Spray) in Adenoids Hypertrophy in Children (P04367)
clinical_study.official_title: Open Label Pilot Trial, Evaluating the Role of Nasonex in the Management of Nasal Obstruction Secondary to Adenoids Hypertrophy in Children

brief_summary.textblock: To document the short term & long term effect of treatment with Nasonex (mometasone furoate nasal spray) in moderate to severe adenoids hypertrophy (which cause > 50% obstruction of the posterior choanae).

primary_outcome.measure: Severity of Nasal Obstruction Symptoms at Baseline and Week 12 as Measured by the Total Clinical Score
primary_outcome.description: Clinical score (based on a 5 point grading system) was assessed for each of 5 nasal obstruction symptoms (oral/mouth breathing, snoring, restless sleep, frequent waking-ups during the night, and obstructive breathing during sleep). Each nasal obstruction symptom was estimated by the parent/guardian of the participant and scored on a scale of 0 (best) to 1 (worst). Total clinical score is a score on a scale (0 = no symptoms [best score] and 5 = worst symptoms [worst score]).

primary_outcome.measure: Degree of Posterior Choana Obstruction at Baseline and Week 12
primary_outcome.description: The degree of obstruction of the posterior choana was assessed by endoscopy. Endoscopy grading consisted of Grade I (minimum), Grade II and Grade III (maximum). Grade I was defined as <50% obstruction, Grade II was defined as 50-75% obstruction, and Grade III was defined as >75% obstruction.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Referred to Surgery (Adenoidectomy) Within 12 Weeks of Start of Therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Severity of Rhinorrhea at Baseline and Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Rhinorrhea is a symptom of allergic rhinitis. Rhinorrhea was assessed using a 3-point scale (0 = no symptoms [best score] and 3 = symptom interferes with daily life activity [worst score]).

secondary_outcome.measure: Severity of Nasal Congestion at Baseline and Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Nasal congestion is a symptom of allergic rhinitis. Nasal congestion was assessed using a 3-point scale (0 = no symptoms [best score] and 3 = symptom interferes with daily life activity [worst score]).

secondary_outcome.measure: Severity of Nasal Itching at Baseline and Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Nasal itching is a symptom of allergic rhinitis. Nasal itching was assessed using a 3-point scale (0 = no symptoms [best score] and 3 = symptom interferes with daily life activity [worst score]).

secondary_outcome.measure: Severity of Sneezing at Baseline and Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Sneezing is a symptom of allergic rhinitis. Sneezing was assessed using a 3-point scale (0 = no symptoms [best score] and 3 = symptom interferes with daily life activity [worst score]).

secondary_outcome.measure: Severity of Eye Symptoms at Baseline and Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Eye symptoms are a symptom of allergic rhinitis. Eye symptoms were assessed using a 3-point scale (0 = no symptoms [best score] and 3 = symptom interferes with daily life activity [worst score]).

intervention.description: One spray (50 mcg per spray) in each nostril once daily (100 mcg daily) for 3 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 2-11 years of age, nasal obstruction for 3 months, adenoids hypertrophy > 50% of posterior choanae.
Exclusion Criteria:
- adenoids hypertrophy < 50% of posterior choanae
recurrent epistaxis or immunodeficiency, severe septal deviation, kissing tonsils, choanal atresia, large masses, known allergy to nasonex (mometasone furoate nasal spray), chronic otitis media, cystic fibrosis, acute infection.
